page.title: 09TEENAGERS IN BARCOMBE.
page.content: {A report by Dawn Read and Emily {Oastler. The following are comments about living in Barcombe today,by teenager Mandy Smith aged 16 years: I have lived in Barcombe for 12.5 years.During that time it has become bigger with more new housing estates.The only shop that has changed is the antique shop,in the centre of the village,which used to be a grocers shop. I enjoy living in Barcombe because it is a nice quiet village.It is a nice friendly place which is better to live in than a larger town like Lewes.You know most of the other young people and you go round in a crowd.This makes it a nice close community.Of course Lewes is very near so you can travel to it quite easily.
